abstract: The New York auction house Guernsey's explained on Thursday that all bidders in its planned winner-take-all auction of more than 5,500 artifacts salvaged from the wreckage of the Titanic must agree to abide by 19 pages' worth of court-ordered covenants and commitments governing the collection.
lead_paragraph: The New York auction house Guernsey's explained on Thursday that all bidders in its planned winner-take-all auction of more than 5,500 artifacts salvaged from the wreckage of the Titanic must agree to abide by 19 pages' worth of court-ordered covenants and commitments governing the collection. "The court has final approval and the right to make sure the buyer has the capability and the desire," said Arlan Ettinger, president of Guernsey's. "It's like getting a puppy," he added. "It takes a great deal of care."

headline.main: Responsible Bidders Sought for Titanic Auction
